Temple is very good and peaceful. Prime and decent Location. Priest is very well behaving and good. \n\n This is having good number of volunteers and devotees. All are co-operative and friendly. Volunteers are very active and updating very preciously.
Invite a Volunteer to your temple
It is better to live your own.
Meaning: Imitation of somebody else\'s life with perfection

Located at Chilkur in Moinabad mandal. Around 23 km from Mehdipatnam. \n\n Temple of Lord Sri Venkateshwara also popularly called "Visa Balaji"…!! This name is due to a very large number of devotees with a wish to go to abroad, got their wish fulfilled. It is customary to encircle the temple (known as Pradakshina) eleven times and pray to God for a specific wish. Once this wish comes true, the Devotee has to visit again and perform 108 Pradakshinas. This is one of the very few temples in India which does not accept monetary donations in a Hundi and therefore does not fall under the purview of endowments dept of our Government The Temple circulates a monthly magazine "Vak" which means Speech (Of GOD), nominally priced at Rs 5.00 only. This magazine is the only source of Temple-Income.

Ashtalakshmi Temple is very famous temple of Goddess Lakshmi Devi, is located between DilshukhNagar and LB Nagar. The Rajagopuram of this temple is intricately carved with beautiful designs that catches the eyes of the visitors. Amazing temple with ample parking. Not commercialized and retains the spiritual aspect. A very well maintained temple with peaceful ambience. Temple timings: All days of the week from 6:00 AM - 12:00 noon and from 5:00 PM - 9:00 PM

Chilkur Balaji Temple, popularly known as "Visa Balaji Temple'', is an ancient Hindu temple of Lord Balaji on the banks of Osman Sagar in Hyderabad. This temple has no hundi and neither accepts any money from devotees. It has pleasing architecture too, boasting of being one of the oldest temples in Telangana. Temple timings: All days of the week from 5:00 AM - 8:00 pm.

Karmanghat Hanuman temple is one of the oldest temples in the city of Hyderabad. Very old Hanuman temple that dates back 12th Century. It has grown into a big temple complex with multiple deities including Jagannath trinity. Surroundings are neatly maintained. Temple Timings: All days of the week from 6.00 am to 12:00 noon and from 4 pm to 8 pm.

Happiness cannot be traveled to, owned, earned, worn or consumed. Happiness is the spiritual experience of living every minute with love, grace, and gratitude
Just as a candle cannot burn without fire, men cannot live without a spiritual life.
Keep your feet on the ground, but let your heart soar as high as it will. Refuse to be average or to surrender to the chill of your spiritual environment.
Music is the mediator between the spiritual and the sensual life.
You can\'t have a good day with bad attitude, and bad day with good attitude.
One bad day doesn\'t mean you have a bad life. Count your blessings, not your curses.
You don\'t read a book backwards, so why live your life that way?

OM NAMAH SHIVAAY
Nagendra Haaraaya Trilochanaaya
Bhasmanga Raagaya Maheshwaraya
Nithyaaya Suddhaaya Dhigambaraaya
Thasmai Na Kaaraaya Namashivaya Nama Shivaaya 

 I offer my humble salutations to Lord Mahesvara who has a garland of serpants around the neck, who has three eyes, whose body is covered with ash, who is eternal who is pure who has the entire sky as his dress and who is embodies as the first letter Na.

OM SRI HANUMATE NAMAH
Yathra Yathra raghunatha keerthanam
Thathra Thathra kruthamasthakaanjaleem
Pashpavari paripurna lochanam
Maruthim namatha rakshasanthagam

 Lord Maruthi, the terror to demons (Rakshasas) is present wherever praise of Sri Rama is sung, with joyous tears in His eyes and folded hands over His head. To Him we offer our salutation (Namaskarams).

OM SHRI GANESHAAY NAMAH
Vakratunda Mahakaaya, Suryakoti Samaprabha
Nirvighnam Kuru Mey Deva, Sarva Kaaryeshu Sarvada

Lord Ganesha has a curved trunk with a powerful body. He has the brilliance of a million suns. May the Lord, remove all the problems from the actions I aim to achieve.

OM NAMO NARAYANAYA
Shaantaakaaram bhujagashayanam
padmanaabham suresham
vishvaadhaaram gaganasadrisham
meghavarnam shubhaangam
lakshmeekaantam kamalanayanam
yogihriddhyaanagamyam
vande vishnum bhavabhayaharam
sarvalokaikanaatham.

I bow down before Vishnu, the Lord of all worlds and the remover of all causes of fear. He is of blissful form. He lies on a serpent bed. He sports a lotus on His navel. The Lord of the celestials. He supports the whole cosmos. His limbs are exquisite and His complexion is blue like that of the sky and the rain cloud. The consort of Lakshmi. He has eyes rivaling the lotus. The yogis meditate on Him in their innermost heart.

When we offer Aarthi to the God, why do we sound the bell? 

 (a) To welcome the God 
 (b) When God is having Prashad 
 (c) A traditional to sound along with aarthi, scented sticks, etc 

 Your take ??

Serpents (Snakes) appearing in the dream is good or bad? 

 (a) Generally when we hear or talk about the snakes during the day 
 (b) In our horoscope we have Rahu or Kethu enters 
 (c) Lord Subramania Swamy or Lord Nagendra wants to appear to bless you 

 Your take ??

When you are praying the God, if a flower fall from the idle or photo of the God, can we reuse it for God?

 (a) It’s a God's message that He has blessed you with love. So, don't use it again, rather take it and keep with you. 
 (b) You are not devotedly doing the prayer, not offered the flower carefully. 
 (c) Because it was used for God only. So, we can use it again 

 Your take ??
Look for correct answer tomorrow.

What should we see as soon as you wake up in the morning for good luck 

 (a) Brahmin 
 (b) Cow 
 (c) Yourself in the Mirror 
 (d) Tulasi Tree 
 (e) Your own hands 

 What else we can see, do you know?

Who should feed "First Feed" or Anna Prasana to the baby? 

 (a) Father 
 (b) Mother 
 (c) Uncle (Mother's Brother) 
 (d) Grand Father (Month's father) 

 Who else can feed first?

Lamp should be facing our side or God's side 

 (a) To God side, because we are offering to God 
 (b) Our side, because we need the God's grace on us 
 (c) Doesn't matter 

 What is your take?

What is the meaning and important of Akshitha? 

 (a) Can be used in place of anything to offer to the God, ex: Cloth, etc 
 (b) To bless younger and giving our energy to them 
 (c) In marriage ceremony, both groom and bride exchange electromagnetic energy. 

 What is your take?

Drinking Tea after a meal can cause long term harm?

5 more foods to avoid after food.

Tea/Coffee:
Ayurveda describes some common things that a person should NOT do after having lunch or dinner. Today, health science is backing it up with research and facts. Let's find out what are the things to avoid immediately after consuming a meal.

Both these beverages have benefits when consumed in a moderate amount. Drink them at least one hour after any meal.

 Fruits:
It takes around 20 minutes for any fruit (except bananas) to travel from your stomach and get digested in the intestines. Eating a fruit after a meal gets stuck with the food, thus not traveling in time to the intestines, and getting spoiled as a result, and spoiling the food too!

Don’t bathe
According to Ayurveda, bathing after a meal increases the flow of blood to the hands and legs. Thus the amount of blood around the stomach will decrease. This weakens the digestive system of the stomach.

Sleep:
The food will not be digested properly, leading to gastric issues.

Don’t swim Or do physical exercise
It’s best to wait for at least more than 30 minutes to do any exercise after eating food. This is because more blood is drawn to your gastrointestinal tract after eating, which can cause minor cramps.

Don't loosen your belt
Usually, people loosen their belts after a sumptuous meal. You would feel comfortable once again, which means you may continue overeating. Loosening the belt and then tightening it again can cause the intestine to twist. 

Don't smoke
Now, this rule is not by Ayurveda, but by modern science. Experiments prove that smoking a cigarette right after a meal is comparable to smoking 10 cigarettes.
Chemical Air Fresheners may be damaging to your nerves. Instead, use your favorite essential oils as freshener.
One tablespoon of apple cider VINEGAR in one cup of water before each meal helps in dissolving kidney stones.
Drink half spoon of ginger juice with a tablespoon of honey to cure cold and sore throat.
Avoid plastic containers for storing FOOD. Use glass, steel, ceramic containers. Ceramic is good for Micro oven.
Health benefits of donating blood. Balances iron, improves blood circulation, burns calorie faster, improves lever health, triggers formation of new blood cells.

What are the causes of CVS (Computer Vision Syndrome)?
Less blinking, short focus for long time. So, you can avoid this by doing so

Follow the rule of 20. Take a 20-second break and look 20 feet away every 20 minutes
Take eye break. Avoid working long hours. Close your eyes in your break. Take at least 3 to 5 breaks in a day.
User proper lighting outside.
Adjust the computer screen brightness.
Minimize Glare
Put eye drops to lubricate your eyes.
